meanings.definition: A person who confronts or challenges others aggressively.
meanings.sent1: The confrontationists stood up to the bully on the playground.
meanings.sent2: The confrontationists in the debate club never shy away from expressing their opinions.
meanings.sent3: The confrontationists decided to challenge the teacher to a game of chess for extra credit.
meanings.sent4: The confrontationists were like knights in a chess game, moving boldly to take down their opponents.
meanings.sent5: The image of the confrontationists facing their fears head-on is truly inspiring.

meanings.definition: Those who engage in confrontational behavior or tactics.
meanings.sent1: The group of confrontationists always resort to arguments to prove their point.
meanings.sent2: The confrontationists at the negotiation table refused to back down.
meanings.sent3: The confrontationists decided to settle their differences through a staring contest.
meanings.sent4: The confrontationists were like chess players, making strategic moves to outmaneuver their rivals.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the confrontationists' intense stare-down still lingers in the room.
